newsitem.title: CHINA: China Jan-April Industrial output up 11.4 pct.
newsitem.headline: China Jan-April Industrial output up 11.4 pct.

text.p: China's industrial output from January to April was worth 625 billion yuan ($75.3 billion), up 11.4 percent from the same period of 1996, the State Statistical Bureau said on Thursday.
Industrial output in April alone was worth 174.3 billion yuan, up 11.9 percent year-on-year, the bureau said in a statement.
Industrial output growth had remained steady in April, but losses among industrial enterprises remained serious, the bureau said.
Output from state-owned industrial enterprises grew 5.8 percent year-on-year to 83.5 billion yuan in April, it said.
Output from collective industry grew 14.3 percent to 53.6 billion yuan, while that from township enterprises reached 36.1 billion yuan, up 14.6 percent compared with April 1996, it said.
Output from other types of industry increased 14.6 percent year-on-year to 37.2 billion yuan, it said.
